result.execSummary:
The defendant Leslie A Bolinger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Leslie A Bolinger is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Leslie A Bolinger was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Leslie A Bolinger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant does have a valid DL now and there is resolution on the matters today.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Ct. 1 in 15CM42.  Counts 2, 3, & 4 in 15CM142, 15CT35, & 15CT74 to be dismissed.
Atty Gumz agrees.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a Guilty plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct. 1 in 15CM42.  Counts 2, 3, & 4 in 15CM142, 15CT35, & 15CT74 to be dismissed.

Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  15CM142:  Ct. 1:  Court orders 5 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before June 20, 2016 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Counts 2, 3 & 4 to be dismissed.

15CT35 to be dismissed.
15CT74 to be dismissed.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CT74, 15CM142 & 15CT35 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is valid now and is broke down by the Packwaukee exit.  Atty Gumz asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset  Return date scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Return date at 04-06-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Leslie A Bolinger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM142, 15CT35 & 15CT74 tracking:
Atty Gumz asks for a reset to give more time to get a resolution in place for all three cases.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for April 6, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Return date at 02-03-2016 03:30 pm

Defendant Leslie A Bolinger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM142, 15CT35 and 15CT74  tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that the defendant is trying to work out getting her DL back and asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
authorization for atty to appear
15CT35, 15CT74 & 15CM142 are to track together
Return date at 12-16-2015 02:30 pm

with conditions:
*Appear for booking today
Bond covers both 15CM142 & 15CT74

Defendant Leslie A Bolinger in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CM142, 15CT35 & 15CT74 tracking:
Atty Gumz files an authorization on 15CT35 with the court.  Atty Gumz states that initially this was set for Plea/Sentencing on 15CT35; however these other charges were filed and asks for a return date to be set to get Discovery on the other cases.  Atty Hendee has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Set all three cases for Return.
bond continued in all matters.

15CM142 & 15CT74:
Atty Gumz asks for the initial appearance to be held.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint's in both cases & waives their reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea on both cases.
BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered in both cases.
Court finds probable cause in both cases.

  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond in both matters with conditions.  
Atty Gumz has no objection.
  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions, covers both cases 15CT74 & 15CM142:
*Appear for booking today  Return date scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
